result.reason: Hardcoded pixel constants in DockPaneStripNG.cs (tab max width 200px, icon sizes 16px, gaps) are not DPI-scaled, causing tabs to be too narrow and icons too small on 4K/highDPI screens.
result.approach: Scale the hardcoded tab dimension constants (_DocumentTabMaxWidth, _DocumentIconWidth, _DocumentIconHeight, various gap values) by the current DPI scale factor using DeviceDpi/96f or AutoScaleFactor, so tabs render proportionally on highDPI displays.

attempts.raw_output:
Now I have a clear picture. The issue is that on high-DPI screens, the hardcoded pixel constants in `DockPaneStripNG.cs` (like `_DocumentTabMaxWidth = 200`, `_DocumentIconWidth = 16`, various gap constants) are not DPI-scaled, causing tabs to appear tiny on 4K displays. The `TextRenderer.MeasureText` calls will produce DPI-aware measurements, but the max width cap and icon/gap constants remain at 96-DPI pixel values.
